gr.fire.browser.util
Interface PageListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
Browser, BrowserTest
public interface PageListener

A PageListener registered to a Browser instance will be notified upon completion of requests to Browser.loadPageAsync.

Author:
padeler
See Also:
Browser.loadPageAsync(String, String, Hashtable, byte[])

Method Detail

pageLoadCompleted

void pageLoadCompleted(java.lang.String url,
                       java.lang.String method,
                       java.util.Hashtable requestParams,
                       Page page)
Only called when pageLoadAsync is used to load a page. The rendering of a page was completed. The result is in the Page instance.

Parameters:
url - The usr that was used when the request was made. This may not be the same with the url in the Page parameter since there may have been redirects.
method - The method that was used for the Http request
requestParams - The parameters that where send with the request.
page - The result of the request.

pageLoadFailed

void pageLoadFailed(java.lang.String url,
                    java.lang.String method,
                    java.util.Hashtable requestParams,
                    java.lang.Throwable error)
Only called when pageLoadAsync is used to load a page. The loadPageAsync failed with an exception. A callback to the PageListener is made with the error.

Parameters:
url -
method -
requestParams -
error -

pageLoadProgress

void pageLoadProgress(java.lang.String url,
                      java.lang.String message,
                      byte state,
                      int percent)
This method is called during the loading and rendering of a page to notify about progress. The pageLoadProgress method will be called at least 2 times during the progress of the loading. Once on the loading start, and once on the page completion or abort.

Parameters:
url - The requested URL.
message - A short message. Can be the url or a default status message
state - A value describing the current status of the process. The listener will receive atleast one method call with state PAGE_LOAD_START and one with PAGE_LOAD_END (PAGE_LOAD_START, 112).
percent - The percentage of the page loaded. This is just an estimated value.
